page.title: 06A Farmer's Life
page.content: Mr Harrold has been a farmer all his life. He was born in the house and inherited the farm when his father died. Living at Salamanca Farm in Stoke Holy Cross he is now 45 years old; during his life farming has changed from a natural horse_powered livelihood to a mechanised chemical business. In a good year it is quite lucrative but in a bad year it is not quite so good. It is being affected a good deal by nnational membership of the European Economic Community. He gets up at around 0530 hours, starts milking his 50 cows at 0630hrs. and finishes at 0830. He then milks again from 1500 to 1730 hrs.He employs 2 people on his 168 acres: 1 for driving the tractor, and the other to help him with the cows and other 50 head of fat cattle.
